member.name: T:CoordLib.Dms
member.summary: Geodesy representation conversion functions Latitude/longitude points may be represented as double degrees, or subdivided into sexagesimal minutes and seconds. 1:1 C# translation from above

member.name: F:CoordLib.Dms.Separator
member.summary:
Separator character to be used to separate degrees, minutes, seconds, and cardinal directions.
Set to '\u202f' (narrow no-break space) for improved formatting. * @example * var p = new LatLon(51.2, 0.33); // 51°12′00.0″N, 000°19′48.0″E * Dms.separator = '\u202f'; // narrow no-break space * var pʹ = new LatLon( 51.2, 0.33 ); // 51° 12′ 00.0″ N, 000° 19′ 48.0″ E

member.name: M:CoordLib.Dms.ParseDMS(System.String)
member.summary:
Parses string representing degrees/minutes/seconds into numeric degrees.
This is very flexible on formats, allowing signed double degrees, or deg-min-sec optionally suffixed by compass direction( NSEW). A variety of separators are accepted( eg 3° 37′ 09″W). Seconds and minutes may be omitted.
* @example * var lat = Dms.parseDMS("N51° 28' 40.12\""); * var lon = Dms.parseDMS( "W0° 00' 5.31\"" ); * var p1 = new LatLon( lat, lon ); // N51.4778°, W0.0015°
member.param: {string|number} dmsStr - Degrees or deg/min/sec in variety of formats.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Dms.ToDMS(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts double degrees to deg/min/sec format - degree, prime, double-prime symbols are added, but sign is discarded, though no compass direction is added.
member.param: {number} deg - Degrees to be formatted as specified.
bool - Format Latitude(00 Deg), else it is Longitude(000 Deg)
{string} [format=dms] - Return value as 'd', 'dm', 'dms' for deg, deg+min, deg+min+sec.
{number} [dp=0|2|4] - Number of double places to use – default 0 for dms, 2 for dm, 4 for d.
member.returns: {string} Degrees formatted as deg/min/secs according to specified format.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Dms.ToLat(System.Double,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts numeric degrees to deg/min/sec latitude (2-digit degrees, prefixed with N/S).
member.param: {number} deg - Degrees to be formatted as specified.
{string} [format=dms] - Return value as 'd', 'dm', 'dms' for deg, deg+min, deg+min+sec.
{number} [dp=0|2|4] - Number of double places to use – default 0 for dms, 2 for dm, 4 for d.
member.returns: {string} Degrees formatted as deg/min/secs according to specified format.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Dms.ToLon(System.Double,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert numeric degrees to deg/min/sec longitude (3-digit degrees, prefixed with E/W)
member.param: {number} deg - Degrees to be formatted as specified.
{string} [format=dms] - Return value as 'd', 'dm', 'dms' for deg, deg+min, deg+min+sec.
{number} [dp=0|2|4] - Number of double places to use – default 0 for dms, 2 for dm, 4 for d.
member.returns: {string} Degrees formatted as deg/min/secs according to specified format.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Dms.ToBrng(System.Double,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts numeric degrees to deg/min/sec as a bearing (0°..360°)
member.param: {number} deg - Degrees to be formatted as specified.
{string} [format=dms] - Return value as 'd', 'dm', 'dms' for deg, deg+min, deg+min+sec.
{number} [dp=0|2|4] - Number of double places to use – default 0 for dms, 2 for dm, 4 for d.
member.returns: {string} Degrees formatted as deg/min/secs according to specified format.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Dms.CompassPoint(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns compass point (to given precision) for supplied bearing. * @example * var point = Dms.compassPoint(24); // point = 'NNE' * var point = Dms.compassPoint( 24, 1 ); // point = 'N'
member.param: {number} bearing - Bearing in degrees from north.

member.name: T:CoordLib.Geo
member.summary:
Geodetic functions A pool of static base functions
Derived from - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - */ Latitude/longitude spherical geodesy tools (c) Chris Veness 2002-2017 */ MIT Licence */ www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/latlong.html */ www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/geodesy/docs/module-latlon-spherical.html */ https://github.com/chrisveness/geodesy - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - */

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.DistanceTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the distance from ‘this’ point to destination point (using haversine formula).
member.param: {number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).
member.returns: {number} Distance between this point and destination point, in same units as radius.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.BearingTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the (initial) bearing from ‘this’ point to destination point.
member.returns: {number} Initial bearing in degrees from north.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.FinalBearingTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns final bearing arriving at destination destination point from ‘this’ point; the final bearing will differ from the initial bearing by varying degrees according to distance and latitude.
member.returns: {number} Final bearing in degrees from north.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.MidpointTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the midpoint between ‘this’ point and the supplied point.
member.returns: Lat and Lon of the Mid point as array

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.IntermediatePointTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the point at given fraction between ‘this’ point and specified point.
member.param: {number} fraction - Fraction between the two points (0 = this point, 1 = specified point).
member.returns: Lat and Lon of the intermediate point as array

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.DestinationPoint(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the destination point from ‘this’ point having travelled the given distance on the given initial bearing( bearing normally varies around path followed ).
member.param: {number} distance - Distance travelled, in same units as earth radius (default: metres).
{number} bearing - Initial bearing in degrees from north.
{number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).
member.returns: Lat and Lon of the Destination point as array

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.Intersection(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the point of intersection of two paths defined by point and bearing.
member.param: {number} brng1 - Initial bearing from first point.
{number} brng2 - Initial bearing from second point.
member.returns: Lat and Lon of the Intersection point as array (null if no unique intersection defined)

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.DoubleCrossTrackDistanceTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns (signed) distance from ‘this’ point to great circle defined by start-point and end-point.
member.param: Latitude of Start point of great circle path
Longitude of Start point of great circle path
Latitude of End point of great circle path
Longitude of End point of great circle path
{number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).
member.returns: {number} Distance to great circle (-ve if to left, +ve if to right of path).

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.AlongTrackDistanceTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns how far ‘this’ point is along a path from from start-point, heading towards end-point. That is, if a perpendicular is drawn from ‘this’ point to the( great circle ) path, the along-track distance is the distance from the start point to where the perpendicular crosses the path.
member.param: Latitude of Start point of great circle path
Longitude of Start point of great circle path
Latitude of End point of great circle path
Longitude of End point of great circle path
{number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).
member.returns: {number} Distance along great circle to point nearest ‘this’ point.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.MaxLatitude(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Returns maximum latitude reached when travelling on a great circle on given bearing from this point('Clairaut's formula'). Negate the result for the minimum latitude (in the Southern hemisphere).
The maximum latitude is independent of longitude; it will be the same for all points on a given latitude.

member.name: M:CoordLib.Geo.CrossingParallels(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the pair of meridians at which a great circle defined by two points crosses the given latitude.If the great circle doesn't reach the given latitude, null is returned.
member.param: Latitude of First point defining great circle
Longitude of First point defining great circle
Latitude of Second point defining great circle
Longitude of Second point defining great circle
{number} latitude - Latitude crossings are to be determined for.
member.returns: {Object|null} Object containing { lon1, lon2 } or null if given latitude not reached.

member.name: T:CoordLib.LatLon
member.summary:
Implements a Lat, Lon point 1:1 C# translation of functions from above Redesign to provide Static Functions with Lat/Lon doubles in Geo.XY and using them here for the LatLon Class
Added Altitude for convenience Added UTM Zone resolution
Changed to Struct (Aug 2033/BM)

member.summary: Latitude

member.summary: Creates a LatLon point on the earth's surface at the specified latitude / longitude.

member.summary: Creates a LatLon point on the earth's surface at the specified latitude / longitude / altitude.

member.summary: Creates a LatLon point on the earth's surface at the specified latitude / longitude. as copy of the given LatLon

member.param: {number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).
member.returns: {number} Distance between this point and destination point, in same units as radius.

member.returns: {number} Initial bearing in degrees from north.

member.returns: {number} Final bearing in degrees from north.

member.returns: {LatLon} Midpoint between this point and the supplied point.

member.name: M:CoordLib.LatLon.IntermediatePointTo(CoordLib.LatLon,System.Double)
member.param: {number} fraction - Fraction between the two points (0 = this point, 1 = specified point).
member.returns: {LatLon} Intermediate point between this point and destination point.

member.name: M:CoordLib.LatLon.DestinationPoint(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Returns the destination point from ‘this’ point having travelled the given distance on the given initial bearing( bearing normally varies around path followed ).
* @example * var p1 = new LatLon( 51.4778, -0.0015 ); * var p2 = p1.destinationPoint( 7794, 300.7 ); // 51.5135°N, 000.0983°W
member.param: {number} distance - Distance travelled, in same units as earth radius (default: metres).
{number} bearing - Initial bearing in degrees from north.
{number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).

member.name: M:CoordLib.LatLon.Intersection(CoordLib.LatLon,System.Double,CoordLib.LatLon,System.Double)
member.param: {number} brng1 - Initial bearing from first point.
{number} brng2 - Initial bearing from second point.
member.returns: {LatLon|null} Destination point (null if no unique intersection defined).

member.name: M:CoordLib.LatLon.DoubleCrossTrackDistanceTo(CoordLib.LatLon,CoordLib.LatLon,System.Double)
member.param: {LatLon} pathStart - Start point of great circle path.
{LatLon} pathEnd - End point of great circle path.
{number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).
member.returns: {number} Distance to great circle (-ve if to left, +ve if to right of path).

member.name: M:CoordLib.LatLon.AlongTrackDistanceTo(CoordLib.LatLon,CoordLib.LatLon,System.Double)
member.param: {LatLon} pathStart - Start point of great circle path.
{LatLon} pathEnd - End point of great circle path.
{number} [radius=6371e3] - (Mean) radius of earth (defaults to radius in metres).
member.returns: {number} Distance along great circle to point nearest ‘this’ point.

member.name: M:CoordLib.LatLon.MaxLatitude(System.Double)
member.summary:
Returns maximum latitude reached when travelling on a great circle on given bearing from this point('Clairaut's formula'). Negate the result for the minimum latitude (in the Southern hemisphere).
The maximum latitude is independent of longitude; it will be the same for all points on a given latitude.

member.name: M:CoordLib.LatLon.CrossingParallels(CoordLib.LatLon,CoordLib.LatLon,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the pair of meridians at which a great circle defined by two points crosses the given latitude.If the great circle doesn't reach the given latitude, null is returned.
member.param: {LatLon} point1 - First point defining great circle.
{LatLon} point2 - Second point defining great circle.
{number} latitude - Latitude crossings are to be determined for.
member.returns: {Object|null} Object containing { lon1, lon2 } or null if given latitude not reached.

member.param: {LatLon} point - Point to be compared against this point.

member.param: {number} [dp=0|2|4] - Number of decimal places to use - default 0 for dms, 2 for dm, 4 for d.
